images.caption: Figure 1:A general introduction to UAGLNet. We construct complementary local and global representations of the buildings under the guidance of uncertainty modeling in dual branches, which enforces the model to focus on the ambiguous regions for high-quality building extraction.

Figure 2:Comparison of different hybrid CNN-Transformer structures for building extraction. (a) Parallel CNN-Transformer structure[DBLP:journals/tgrs/WangFM022]; (b) Sequentially Mixed CNN-Transformer structure by stacking CNNs in shallow layers and Transformers in deep layers[DBLP:journals/corr/abs-2102-04306]; (c) Alternative CNN-Transformers structure[DBLP:journals/lgrs/ZhangWZZ23]; (d) Our Cooperative architecture.

Figure 3:The overall framework of UAGLNet. UAGLNet consists of a Cooperative Encoder (CE), a Global-Local Fusion module (GLF) and an Uncertainty-Aggregated Decoder (UAD). In CE, the intermediate cooperative interaction block (CIB) is introduced to narrow the gap between the local and global features. The hierarchical features are fed into GLF and UAD for feature fusion and uncertainty aggregation.

Figure 4:(a) Details of the multi-kernel feature modulator in our cooperative encoder (CE). (b) Illustration of the CIB, which stacks hybrid CNN and transformer layers for global-local information interaction.

Figure 5:Visual comparison with the representative state-of-the-art methods on Massachusetts building dataset. (a) Image; (b) Ground Truth; (c) UAGLNet; (d) UNet; (e) HRNet; (f) BuildFormer; (g) DSATNet.

Figure 6:Visual comparison with the representative state-of-the-art methods on Inria Aerial Image Labeling dataset. (a) Image; (b) Ground Truth; (c) UAGLNet; (d) UNet; (e) HRNet; (f) BuildFormer; (g) DSATNet.
Figure 7:Visual comparison with the representative state-of-the-art methods on WHU building dataset. (a) Image; (b) Ground Truth; (c) UAGLNet; (d) UNet; (e) HRNet; (f) BuildFormer; (g) DSATNet.

Figure 8:The visualized features in the Uncertainty-Aggregated Decoder (UAD). The irrelevant noises inùêÖL\mathbf{F}_{L}are suppressed and the low-confidence uncertain regions inùêÖG\mathbf{F}_{G}are aggregated within the red rectangles.
